intro: Alicabon somniferum, commonly known as the opium poppy, is a flowering plant native to the region of the eastern Mediterranean. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and large, lobed leaves. The plant produces striking blue or purple flowers that bloom in late spring. Its most notable botanical feature is the蒴果 (capsule), which contains the latex-rich seeds used to produce opium. This plant has been cultivated for centuries for its medicinal and recreational properties.
